  1. “I found that accepting and maintaining third party patches contributed to my burn out […] Small contributions typically required hours of my time to properly test and validate them.” I felt this in my bones. I appreciate contributions but large PRs are so draining (Sorry 😭) @changelog/1354858029796229125

    1. …in reply to @zachleat
      A bunch of nuance here to project scale but my opinions around best practices are: * Yay to small bug fix PRs * Ask to work on an enhancement *before* you write any code (even if it’s small) * Don’t get mad if I say “no thanks” (more so if you didn’t ask beforehand)
